result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

08:39 AM   Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State. Defendant, James E. Curtis, appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF785/22CF924/22CM760/22TR5428-29.   DE waives preliminary hearing in Cases 22CF785 and 22CF924; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney Celebre in court.  Bond continued. The Court will enter not guilty pleas in Cases 22TR5428 and 22TR5429. Case 22CM760 and 22TR5428-29 continue to trail.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
DENIED by court.
